name: api_paste_config
description: File name for the paste.deploy config for api service
label: environment

name: wsgi_log_format
description: A python format string that is used as the template to generate log  lines. The following values can beformatted into it: client_ip,  date_time, request_line, status_code, body_length, wall_seconds.
label: debuggability

name: tcp_keepidle
description: Sets the value of TCP_KEEPIDLE in seconds for each server socket. Not supported on OS X.
label: reliability

name: wsgi_default_pool_size
description: Size of the pool of greenthreads used by wsgi
label: performance

name: max_header_line
description: Maximum line size of message headers to be accepted. max_header_line  may need to be increased when using large tokens (typically those  generated when keystone is configured to use PKI tokens with big service catalogs).
label: performance

name: wsgi_keep_alive
description: If False, closes the client socket connection explicitly.
label: reliability

name: client_socket_timeout
description: Timeout for client connections' socket operations. If an incoming  connection is idle for this number of seconds it will be closed. A value of '0' means wait forever.
label: reliability

name: rpc_conn_pool_size
description: Size of RPC connection pool.
label: performance

name: conn_pool_min_size
description: The pool size limit for connections expiration policy
label: reliability

name: conn_pool_ttl
description: The time-to-live in sec of idle connections in the pool
label: reliability

name: executor_thread_pool_size
description: Size of executor thread pool when executor is threading or eventlet.
label: performance

name: rpc_response_timeout
description: Seconds to wait for a response from a call.
label: reliability

name: transport_url
description: The network address and optional user credentials for connecting to  the messaging backend, in URL format. The expected format is:
label: environment

name: control_exchange
description: The default exchange under which topics are scoped. May be overridden by an exchange name specified in the transport_url option.
label: manageability

name: debug
description: If set to true, the logging level will be set to DEBUG instead of the default INFO level.
label: debuggability

name: log_config_append
description: The name of a logging configuration file. This file is appended to  any existing logging configuration files. For details about logging  configuration files, see the Python logging module documentation. Note  that when logging configuration files are used then all logging  configuration is set in the configuration file and other logging  configuration options are ignored (for example, log-date-format).
label: environment

name: log_date_format
description: Defines the format string for %(asctime)s in log records. Default:  the value above . This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: log_file
description: (Optional) Name of log file to send logging output to. If no default  is set, logging will go to stderr as defined by use_stderr. This option  is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: log_dir
description: (Optional) The base directory used for relative log_file  paths. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: environment

name: watch_log_file
description: Uses logging handler designed to watch file system. When log file is  moved or removed this handler will open a new log file with specified  path instantaneously. It makes sense only if log_file option is  specified and Linux platform is used. This option is ignored if  log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_syslog
description: Use syslog for logging. Existing syslog format is DEPRECATED and will be changed later to honor RFC5424. This option is ignored if  log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_journal
description: Enable journald for logging. If running in a systemd environment you  may wish to enable journal support. Doing so will use the journal native protocol which includes structured metadata in addition to log  messages.This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: syslog_log_facility
description: Syslog facility to receive log lines. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_json
description: Use JSON formatting for logging. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_stderr
description: Log output to standard error. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_eventlog
description: Log output to Windows Event Log.
label: debuggability

name: log_rotate_interval
description: The amount of time before the log files are rotated. This option is ignored unless log_rotation_type is setto 'interval'.
label: reliability

name: log_rotate_interval_type
description: Rotation interval type. The time of the last file change (or the time when the service was started) is used when scheduling the next  rotation.
label: reliability

name: max_logfile_count
description: Maximum number of rotated log files.
label: reliability

name: max_logfile_size_mb
description: Log file maximum size in MB. This option is ignored if 'log_rotation_type' is not set to 'size'.
label: reliability

name: log_rotation_type
description: Log rotation type.
label: debuggability

name: logging_context_format_string
description: Format string to use for log messages with context. Used by oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: logging_default_format_string
description: Format string to use for log messages when context is undefined. Used by oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: logging_debug_format_suffix
description: Additional data to append to log message when logging level for the  message is DEBUG. Used by oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: logging_exception_prefix
description: Prefix each line of exception output with this format. Used by oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: logging_user_identity_format
description: Defines the format string for %(user_identity)s that is used in  logging_context_format_string. Used by  oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: default_log_levels
description: List of package logging levels in logger=LEVEL pairs. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: publish_errors
description: Enables or disables publication of error events.
label: debuggability

name: instance_format
description: The format for an instance that is passed with the log message.
label: debuggability

name: instance_uuid_format
description: The format for an instance UUID that is passed with the log message.
label: debuggability

name: rate_limit_interval
description: Interval, number of seconds, of log rate limiting.
label: reliability

name: rate_limit_burst
description: Maximum number of logged messages per rate_limit_interval.
label: reliability

name: rate_limit_except_level
description: Log level name used by rate limiting: CRITICAL, ERROR, INFO, WARNING, DEBUG or empty string. Logs with level greater or equal to  rate_limit_except_level are not filtered. An empty string means that all levels are filtered.
label: debuggability

name: fatal_deprecations
description: Enables or disables fatal status of deprecations.
label: reliability

name: state_path
description: Where to store Neutron state files. This directory must be writable by the agent.
label: environment

name: bind_host
description: The host IP to bind to.
label: environment

name: bind_port
description: The port to bind to
label: environment

name: api_extensions_path
description: The path for API extensions. Note that this can be a colon-separated  list of paths. For example: api_extensions_path =  extensions:/path/to/more/exts:/even/more/exts. The __path__ of  neutron.extensions is appended to this, so if your extensions are in  there you don't need to specify them here.
label: environment

name: auth_strategy
description: The type of authentication to use
label: security

name: core_plugin
description: The core plugin Neutron will use
label: environment

name: service_plugins
description: The service plugins Neutron will use
label: manageability

name: base_mac
description: The base MAC address Neutron will use for VIFs. The first 3 octets  will remain unchanged. If the 4th octet is not 00, it will also be used. The others will be randomly generated.
label: environment

name: allow_bulk
description: Allow the usage of the bulk API
label: manageability

name: pagination_max_limit
description: The maximum number of items returned in a single response, value was 'infinite' or negative integer means no limit
label: reliability

name: default_availability_zones
description: Default value of availability zone hints. The availability zone aware schedulers use this when the resources availability_zone_hints is  empty. Multiple availability zones can be specified by a comma separated string. This value can be empty. In this case, even if  availability_zone_hints for a resource is empty, availability zone is  considered for high availability while scheduling the resource.
label: performance

name: max_dns_nameservers
description: Maximum number of DNS nameservers per subnet
label: reliability

name: max_subnet_host_routes
description: Maximum number of host routes per subnet
label: reliability

name: ipv6_pd_enabled
description: Enables IPv6 Prefix Delegation for automatic subnet CIDR allocation.  Set to True to enable IPv6 Prefix Delegation for subnet allocation in a  PD-capable environment. Users making subnet creation requests for IPv6  subnets without providing a CIDR or subnetpool ID will be given a CIDR  via the Prefix Delegation mechanism. Note that enabling PD will override the behavior of the default IPv6 subnetpool.
label: security

name: dhcp_lease_duration
description: DHCP lease duration (in seconds). Use -1 to tell dnsmasq to use infinite lease times.
label: reliability

name: dns_domain
description: Domain to use for building the hostnames
label: environment

name: external_dns_driver
description: Driver for external DNS integration.
label: environment

name: dhcp_agent_notification
description: Allow sending resource operation notification to DHCP agent
label: security

name: allow_overlapping_ips
description: Allow overlapping IP support in Neutron. Attention: the following  parameter MUST be set to False if Neutron is being used in conjunction  with Nova security groups.
label: security

name: host
description: This option has a sample default set, which means that its actual default value may vary from the one documented above.
label: environment

name: network_link_prefix
description: This string is prepended to the normal URL that is returned in links  to the OpenStack Network API. If it is empty (the default), the URLs are returned unchanged.
label: environment

name: notify_nova_on_port_status_changes
description: Send notification to nova when port status changes
label: reliability

name: notify_nova_on_port_data_changes
description: Send notification to nova when port data (fixed_ips/floatingip) changes so nova can update its cache.
label: reliability

name: send_events_interval
description: Number of seconds between sending events to nova if there are any events to send.
label: reliability

name: setproctitle
description: Set process name to match child worker role. Available options are:  'off' - retains the previous behavior; 'on' - renames processes to  'neutron-server: role (original string)'; 'brief' - renames the same as  'on', but without the original string, such as 'neutron-server: role'.
label: manageability

name: ipam_driver
description: Neutron IPAM (IP address management) driver to use. By default, the reference implementation of the Neutron IPAM driver is used.
label: environment

name: vlan_transparent
description: If True, then allow plugins that support it to create VLAN transparent networks.
label: manageability

name: filter_validation
description: If True, then allow plugins to decide whether to perform validations  on filter parameters. Filter validation is enabled if this config is  turned on and it is supported by all plugins
label: manageability

name: global_physnet_mtu
description: MTU of the underlying physical network. Neutron uses this value to  calculate MTU for all virtual network components. For flat and VLAN  networks, neutron uses this value without modification. For overlay  networks such as VXLAN, neutron automatically subtracts the overlay  protocol overhead from this value. Defaults to 1500, the standard value  for Ethernet.
label: reliability

name: backlog
description: Number of backlog requests to configure the socket with
label: performance

name: retry_until_window
description: Number of seconds to keep retrying to listen
label: reliability

name: use_ssl
description: Enable SSL on the API server
label: security

name: periodic_interval
description: Seconds between running periodic tasks.
label: reliability

name: api_workers
description: Number of separate API worker processes for service. If not  specified, the default is equal to the number of CPUs available for best performance, capped by potential RAM usage.
label: performance

name: rpc_workers
description: Number of RPC worker processes for service. If not specified, the default is equal to half the number of API workers.
label: performance

name: rpc_state_report_workers
description: Number of RPC worker processes dedicated to state reports queue.
label: performance

name: periodic_fuzzy_delay
description: Range of seconds to randomly delay when starting the periodic task scheduler to reduce stampeding. (Disable by setting to 0)
label: performance

name: rpc_response_max_timeout
description: Maximum seconds to wait for a response from an RPC call.
label: reliability

name: interface_driver
description: The driver used to manage the virtual interface.
label: environment

name: metadata_proxy_socket
description: Location for Metadata Proxy UNIX domain socket.
label: environment

name: metadata_proxy_user
description: User (uid or name) running metadata proxy after its initialization (if empty: agent effective user).
label: environment

name: metadata_proxy_group
description: Group (gid or name) running metadata proxy after its initialization (if empty: agent effective group).
label: environment

name: agent_down_time
description: Seconds to regard the agent is down; should be at least twice report_interval, to be sure the agent is down for good.
label: reliability

name: dhcp_load_type
description: Representing the resource type whose load is being reported by the  agent. This can be 'networks', 'subnets' or 'ports'. When specified  (Default is networks), the server will extract particular load sent as  part of its agent configuration object from the agent report state,  which is the number of resources being consumed, at every  report_interval.dhcp_load_type can be used in combination with  network_scheduler_driver =  neutron.scheduler.dhcp_agent_scheduler.WeightScheduler When the  network_scheduler_driver is WeightScheduler, dhcp_load_type can be  configured to represent the choice for the resource being balanced.  Example: dhcp_load_type=networks
label: manageability

name: enable_new_agents
description: Agent starts with admin_state_up=False when enable_new_agents=False.  In the case, user's resources will not be scheduled automatically to the agent until admin changes admin_state_up to True.
label: reliability

name: max_routes
description: Maximum number of routes per router
label: reliability

name: enable_snat_by_default
description: Define the default value of enable_snat if not provided in external_gateway_info.
label: reliability

name: network_scheduler_driver
description: Driver to use for scheduling network to DHCP agent
label: environment

name: network_auto_schedule
description: Allow auto scheduling networks to DHCP agent.
label: manageability

name: allow_automatic_dhcp_failover
description: Automatically remove networks from offline DHCP agents.
label: reliability

name: dhcp_agents_per_network
description: Number of DHCP agents scheduled to host a tenant network. If this  number is greater than 1, the scheduler automatically assigns multiple  DHCP agents for a given tenant network, providing high availability for  DHCP service.
label: performance

name: enable_services_on_agents_with_admin_state_down
description: Enable services on an agent with admin_state_up False. If this option is False, when admin_state_up of an agent is turned False, services on  it will be disabled. Agents with admin_state_up False are not selected  for automatic scheduling regardless of this option. But manual  scheduling to such agents is available if this option is True.
label: manageability

name: dvr_base_mac
description: The base mac address used for unique DVR instances by Neutron. The  first 3 octets will remain unchanged. If the 4th octet is not 00, it  will also be used. The others will be randomly generated. The  'dvr_base_mac' must be different from 'base_mac' to avoid  mixing them up with MAC's allocated for tenant ports. A 4 octet example  would be dvr_base_mac = fa:16:3f:4f:00:00. The default is 3 octet
label: environment

name: router_distributed
description: System-wide flag to determine the type of router that tenants can create. Only admin can override.
label: manageability

name: enable_dvr
description: Determine if setup is configured for DVR. If False, DVR API extension will be disabled.
label: performance

name: host_dvr_for_dhcp
description: Flag to determine if hosting a DVR local router to the DHCP agent is  desired. If False, any L3 function supported by the DHCP agent instance  will not be possible, for instance: DNS.
label: performance

name: router_scheduler_driver
description: Driver to use for scheduling router to a default L3 agent
label: environment

name: router_auto_schedule
description: Allow auto scheduling of routers to L3 agent.
label: manageability

name: allow_automatic_l3agent_failover
description: Automatically reschedule routers from offline L3 agents to online L3 agents.
label: reliability

name: l3_ha
description: Enable HA mode for virtual routers.
label: reliability

name: max_l3_agents_per_router
description: Maximum number of L3 agents which a HA router will be scheduled on.  If it is set to 0 then the router will be scheduled on every agent.
label: reliability

name: l3_ha_net_cidr
description: Subnet used for the l3 HA admin network.
label: environment

name: l3_ha_network_type
description: The network type to use when creating the HA network for an HA  router. By default or if empty, the first 'tenant_network_types' is  used. This is helpful when the VRRP traffic should use a specific  network which is not the default one.
label: manageability

name: l3_ha_network_physical_name
description: The physical network name with which the HA network can be created.
label: environment

name: max_allowed_address_pair
description: Maximum number of allowed address pairs
label: reliability

name: root_helper
description: Root helper application. Use 'sudo neutron-rootwrap  /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf' to use the real root filter facility. Change to 'sudo' to skip the filtering and just run the command directly.
label: security

name: use_helper_for_ns_read
description: Use the root helper when listing the namespaces on a system. This may not be required depending on the security configuration. If the root  helper is not required, set this to False for a performance improvement.
label: security

name: root_helper_daemon
description: Root helper daemon application to use when possible.
label: security

name: report_interval
description: Seconds between nodes reporting state to server; should be less than  agent_down_time, best if it is half or less than agent_down_time.
label: reliability

name: log_agent_heartbeats
description: Log agent heartbeats
label: reliability

name: comment_iptables_rules
description: Add comments to iptables rules. Set to false to disallow the addition of comments to generated iptables rules that describe each rule's  purpose. System must support the iptables comments module for addition  of comments.
label: manageability

name: debug_iptables_rules
description: Duplicate every iptables difference calculation to ensure the format  being generated matches the format of iptables-save. This option should  not be turned on for production systems because it imposes a performance penalty.
label: performance

name: check_child_processes_action
description: Action to be executed when a child process dies
label: reliability

name: check_child_processes_interval
description: Interval between checks of child process liveness (seconds), use 0 to disable
label: reliability

name: kill_scripts_path
description: Location of scripts used to kill external processes. Names of scripts here must follow the pattern: '<process-name>-kill' where  <process-name> is name of the process which should be killed using this script. For example, kill script for dnsmasq process should be  named 'dnsmasq-kill'. If path is set to None, then default 'kill'  command will be used to stop processes.
label: environment

name: availability_zone
description: Availability zone of this node
label: manageability

name: allowed_origin
description: Indicate whether this resource may be shared with the domain received in the requests 'origin' header. Format:  '<protocol>://<host>[:<port>]', no trailing slash.  Example: https://horizon.example.com
label: manageability

name: allow_credentials
description: Indicate that the actual request can include user credentials
label: manageability

name: expose_headers
description: Indicate which headers are safe to expose to the API. Defaults to HTTP Simple Headers.
label: manageability

name: max_age
description: Maximum cache age of CORS preflight requests.
label: performance

name: allow_methods
description: Indicate which methods can be used during the actual request.
label: manageability

name: allow_headers
description: Indicate which header field names may be used during the actual request.
label: manageability

name: sqlite_synchronous
description: If True, SQLite uses synchronous mode.
label: manageability

name: backend
description: The back end to use for the database.
label: environment

name: connection
description: The SQLAlchemy connection string to use to connect to the database.
label: manageability

name: slave_connection
description: The SQLAlchemy connection string to use to connect to the slave database.
label: manageability

name: mysql_sql_mode
description: The SQL mode to be used for MySQL sessions. This option, including  the default, overrides any server-set SQL mode. To use whatever SQL mode is set by the server configuration, set this to no value. Example:  mysql_sql_mode=
label: manageability

name: mysql_enable_ndb
description: If True, transparently enables support for handling MySQL Cluster (NDB).
label: manageability

name: connection_recycle_time
description: Connections which have been present in the connection pool longer  than this number of seconds will be replaced with a new one the next  time they are checked out from the pool.
label: reliability

name: min_pool_size
description: Minimum number of SQL connections to keep open in a pool.
label: performance

name: max_pool_size
description: Maximum number of SQL connections to keep open in a pool. Setting a value of 0 indicates no limit.
label: reliability

name: max_retries
description: Maximum number of database connection retries during startup. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count.
label: reliability

name: retry_interval
description: Interval between retries of opening a SQL connection.
label: reliability

name: max_overflow
description: If set, use this value for max_overflow with SQLAlchemy.
label: reliability

name: connection_debug
description: Verbosity of SQL debugging information: 0=None, 100=Everything.
label: debuggability

name: connection_trace
description: Add Python stack traces to SQL as comment strings.
label: debuggability

name: pool_timeout
description: If set, use this value for pool_timeout with SQLAlchemy.
label: reliability

name: use_db_reconnect
description: Enable the experimental use of database reconnect on connection lost.
label: reliability

name: db_retry_interval
description: Seconds between retries of a database transaction.
label: reliability

name: db_inc_retry_interval
description: If True, increases the interval between retries of a database operation up to db_max_retry_interval.
label: reliability

name: db_max_retry_interval
description: If db_inc_retry_interval is set, the maximum seconds between retries of a database operation.
label: reliability

name: db_max_retries
description: Maximum retries in case of connection error or deadlock error before  error is raised. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count.
label: reliability

name: connection_parameters
description: Optional URL parameters to append onto the connection URL at connect time; specify as param1=value1&param2=value2&'
label: manageability

name: engine
description: Database engine for which script will be generated when using offline migration.
label: environment

name: www_authenticate_uri
description: Complete 'public' Identity API endpoint. This endpoint should not be  an 'admin' endpoint, as it should be accessible by all end users.  Unauthenticated clients are redirected to this endpoint to authenticate. Although this endpoint should ideally be unversioned, client support in the wild varies. If you're using a versioned v2 endpoint here, then  this should not be the same endpoint the service user utilizes  for validating tokens, because normal end users may not be able to reach that endpoint.
label: security

name: auth_uri
description: Complete 'public' Identity API endpoint. This endpoint should not be  an 'admin' endpoint, as it should be accessible by all end users.  Unauthenticated clients are redirected to this endpoint to authenticate. Although this endpoint should ideally be unversioned, client support in the wild varies. If you're using a versioned v2 endpoint here, then  this should not be the same endpoint the service user utilizes  for validating tokens, because normal end users may not be able to reach that endpoint. This option is deprecated in favor of  www_authenticate_uri and will be removed in the S release.
label: security

name: auth_version
description: API version of the admin Identity API endpoint.
label: environment

name: delay_auth_decision
description: Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but  delegate the authorization decision to downstream WSGI components.
label: security

name: http_connect_timeout
description: Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API server.
label: reliability

name: http_request_max_retries
description: How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating with Identity API Server.
label: reliability

name: cache
description: Request environment key where the Swift cache object is stored. When  auth_token middleware is deployed with a Swift cache, use this option to have the middleware share a caching backend with swift. Otherwise, use  the memcached_servers option instead.
label: performance

name: certfile
description: Required if identity server requires client certificate
label: security

name: keyfile
description: Required if identity server requires client certificate
label: security

name: cafile
description: A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs connections. Defaults to system CAs.
label: security

name: insecure
description: Verify HTTPS connections.
label: security

name: region_name
description: The region in which the identity server can be found.
label: environment

name: signing_dir
description: Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. This option has  been deprecated in the Ocata release and will be removed in the P  release.
label: security

name: memcached_servers
description: Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for caching.  If left undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process.
label: performance

name: token_cache_time
description: In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, the  middleware caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration (in seconds). Set to -1 to disable caching completely.
label: performance

name: memcache_security_strategy
description: (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be  authenticated or authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is  authenticated (with HMAC) in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is  encrypted and authenticated in the cache. If the value is not one of  these options or empty, auth_token will raise an exception on  initialization.
label: security

name: memcache_secret_key
description: (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string is used for key derivation.
label: security

name: memcache_pool_dead_retry
description: (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it is tried again.
label: reliability

name: memcache_pool_maxsize
description: (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached server.
label: reliability

name: memcache_pool_socket_timeout
description: (Optional) Socket timeout in seconds for communicating with a memcached server.
label: reliability

name: memcache_pool_unused_timeout
description: (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in the pool before it is closed.
label: reliability

name: memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout
description: (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached client connection from the pool.
label: reliability

name: memcache_use_advanced_pool
description: (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The advanced pool will only work under python 2.x.
label: reliability

name: include_service_catalog
description: (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If  False, middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation  and will not set the X-Service-Catalog header.
label: manageability

name: enforce_token_bind
description: Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set to:  'disabled' to not check token binding. 'permissive' (default) to  validate binding information if the bind type is of a form known to the  server and ignore it if not. 'strict' like 'permissive' but if the bind  type is unknown the token will be rejected. 'required' any form of token binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a binding method  that must be present in tokens.
label: security

name: hash_algorithms
description: Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a single  algorithm or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python  standard hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so  put the preferred one first for performance. The result of the first  hash will be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more  secure one. Once all the old tokens are expired this option should be  set to a single value for better performance.
label: performance

name: service_token_roles
description: A choice of roles that must be present in a service token. Service  tokens are allowed to request that an expired token can be used and so  this check should tightly control that only actual services should be  sending this token. Roles here are applied as an ANY check so any role  in this list must be present. For backwards compatibility reasons this  currently only affects the allow_expired check.
label: security

name: service_token_roles_required
description: For backwards compatibility reasons we must let valid service tokens  pass that don't pass the service_token_roles check as valid. Setting  this true will become the default in a future release and should be  enabled if possible.
label: security

name: auth_type
description: Authentication type to load
label: security

name: auth_section
description: Config Section from which to load plugin specific options
label: security

name: region_name
description: Name of nova region to use. Useful if keystone manages more than one region.
label: environment

name: endpoint_type
description: Type of the nova endpoint to use.  This endpoint will be looked up in the keystone catalog and should be one of public, internal or admin.
label: security

name: auth_url
description: Authentication URL
label: security

name: auth_type
description: Authentication type to load
label: security

name: cafile
description: PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs connections.
label: security

name: certfile
description: PEM encoded client certificate cert file
label: security

name: collect_timing
description: Collect per-API call timing information.
label: debuggability

name: default_domain_id
description: Optional domain ID to use with v3 and v2 parameters. It will be used  for both the user and project domain in v3 and ignored in v2  authentication.
label: environment

name: default_domain_name
description: Optional domain name to use with v3 API and v2 parameters. It will be used for both the user and project domain in v3 and ignored in v2  authentication.
label: environment

name: domain_id
description: Domain ID to scope to
label: environment

name: domain_name
description: Domain name to scope to
label: environment

name: insecure
description: Verify HTTPS connections.
label: security

name: keyfile
description: PEM encoded client certificate key file
label: security

name: password
description: User's password
label: security

name: project_domain_id
description: Domain ID containing project
label: environment

name: project_domain_name
description: Domain name containing project
label: environment

name: project_id
description: Project ID to scope to
label: environment

name: project_name
description: Project name to scope to
label: environment

name: split_loggers
description: Log requests to multiple loggers.
label: manageability

name: system_scope
description: Scope for system operations
label: environment

name: tenant_id
description: Tenant ID
label: environment

name: tenant_name
description: Tenant Name
label: environment

name: timeout
description: Timeout value for http requests
label: reliability

name: trust_id
description: Trust ID
label: security

name: user_domain_id
description: User's domain id
label: security

name: user_domain_name
description: User's domain name
label: security

name: user_id
description: User id
label: security

name: username
description: Username
label: security

name: disable_process_locking
description: Enables or disables inter-process locks.
label: reliability

name: lock_path
description: Directory to use for lock files.  For security, the specified  directory should only be writable by the user running the processes that need locking. Defaults to environment variable OSLO_LOCK_PATH. If  external locks are used, a lock path must be set.
label: security

name: container_name
description: Name for the AMQP container. must be globally unique. Defaults to a generated UUID
label: environment

name: idle_timeout
description: Timeout for inactive connections (in seconds)
label: reliability

name: trace
description: Debug: dump AMQP frames to stdout
label: debuggability

name: ssl
description: Attempt to connect via SSL. If no other ssl-related parameters are  given, it will use the system's CA-bundle to verify the server's  certificate.
label: security

name: ssl_ca_file
description: CA certificate PEM file used to verify the server's certificate
label: security

name: ssl_cert_file
description: Self-identifying certificate PEM file for client authentication
label: security

name: ssl_key_file
description: Private key PEM file used to sign ssl_cert_file certificate (optional)
label: security

name: ssl_key_password
description: Password for decrypting ssl_key_file (if encrypted)
label: security

name: ssl_verify_vhost
description: By default SSL checks that the name in the server's certificate  matches the hostname in the transport_url. In some configurations it may be preferable to use the virtual hostname instead, for example if the  server uses the Server Name Indication TLS extension (rfc6066) to  provide a certificate per virtual host. Set ssl_verify_vhost to True if  the server's SSL certificate uses the virtual host name instead of the  DNS name.
label: security

name: sasl_mechanisms
description: Space separated list of acceptable SASL mechanisms
label: security

name: sasl_config_dir
description: Path to directory that contains the SASL configuration
label: security

name: sasl_config_name
description: Name of configuration file (without .conf suffix)
label: security

name: sasl_default_realm
description: SASL realm to use if no realm present in username
label: security

name: connection_retry_interval
description: Seconds to pause before attempting to re-connect.
label: reliability

name: connection_retry_backoff
description: Increase the connection_retry_interval by this many seconds after each unsuccessful failover attempt.
label: reliability

name: connection_retry_interval_max
description: Maximum limit for connection_retry_interval + connection_retry_backoff
label: reliability

name: link_retry_delay
description: Time to pause between re-connecting an AMQP 1.0 link that failed due to a recoverable error.
label: reliability

name: default_reply_retry
description: The maximum number of attempts to re-send a reply message which failed due to a recoverable error.
label: reliability

name: default_reply_timeout
description: The deadline for an rpc reply message delivery.
label: reliability

name: default_send_timeout
description: The deadline for an rpc cast or call message delivery. Only used when caller does not provide a timeout expiry.
label: reliability

name: default_notify_timeout
description: The deadline for a sent notification message delivery. Only used when caller does not provide a timeout expiry.
label: reliability

name: default_sender_link_timeout
description: The duration to schedule a purge of idle sender links. Detach link after expiry.
label: reliability

name: addressing_mode
description: Indicates the addressing mode used by the driver. Permitted values: 'legacy'   - use legacy non-routable addressing 'routable' - use routable addresses 'dynamic'  - use legacy addresses if the message bus does not support routing otherwise use routable addressing
label: security

name: pseudo_vhost
description: Enable virtual host support for those message buses that do not  natively support virtual hosting (such as qpidd). When set to true the  virtual host name will be added to all message bus addresses,  effectively creating a private 'subnet' per virtual host. Set to False  if the message bus supports virtual hosting using the 'hostname' field  in the AMQP 1.0 Open performative as the name of the virtual host.
label: security

name: server_request_prefix
description: address prefix used when sending to a specific server
label: manageability

name: broadcast_prefix
description: address prefix used when broadcasting to all servers
label: manageability

name: group_request_prefix
description: address prefix when sending to any server in group
label: manageability

name: rpc_address_prefix
description: Address prefix for all generated RPC addresses
label: manageability

name: notify_address_prefix
description: Address prefix for all generated Notification addresses
label: manageability

name: multicast_address
description: Appended to the address prefix when sending a fanout message. Used by the message bus to identify fanout messages.
label: manageability

name: unicast_address
description: Appended to the address prefix when sending to a particular  RPC/Notification server. Used by the message bus to identify messages  sent to a single destination.
label: environment

name: anycast_address
description: Appended to the address prefix when sending to a group of consumers.  Used by the message bus to identify messages that should be delivered in a round-robin fashion across consumers.
label: environment

name: default_notification_exchange
description: Exchange name used in notification addresses. Exchange name resolution precedence: Target.exchange if set else default_notification_exchange if set else control_exchange if set else 'notify'
label: environment

name: default_rpc_exchange
description: Exchange name used in RPC addresses. Exchange name resolution precedence: Target.exchange if set else default_rpc_exchange if set else control_exchange if set else 'rpc'
label: environment

name: reply_link_credit
description: Window size for incoming RPC Reply messages.
label: performance

name: rpc_server_credit
description: Window size for incoming RPC Request messages
label: performance

name: notify_server_credit
description: Window size for incoming Notification messages
label: performance

name: pre_settled
description: Send messages of this type pre-settled. Pre-settled messages will not receive acknowledgement from the peer. Note well: pre-settled messages may be silently discarded if the delivery fails. Permitted values: 'rpc-call' - send RPC Calls pre-settled 'rpc-reply'- send RPC Replies pre-settled 'rpc-cast' - Send RPC Casts pre-settled 'notify'   - Send Notifications pre-settled
label: manageability

name: kafka_max_fetch_bytes
description: Max fetch bytes of Kafka consumer
label: performance

name: kafka_consumer_timeout
description: Default timeout(s) for Kafka consumers
label: reliability

name: pool_size
description: Pool Size for Kafka Consumers
label: performance

name: conn_pool_min_size
description: The pool size limit for connections expiration policy
label: reliability

name: conn_pool_ttl
description: The time-to-live in sec of idle connections in the pool
label: reliability

name: consumer_group
description: Group id for Kafka consumer. Consumers in one group will coordinate message consumption
label: environment

name: producer_batch_timeout
description: Upper bound on the delay for KafkaProducer batching in seconds
label: reliability

name: producer_batch_size
description: Size of batch for the producer async send
label: performance

name: enable_auto_commit
description: Enable asynchronous consumer commits
label: manageability

name: max_poll_records
description: The maximum number of records returned in a poll call
label: performance

name: security_protocol
description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers
label: security

name: sasl_mechanism
description: Mechanism when security protocol is SASL
label: security

name: ssl_cafile
description: CA certificate PEM file used to verify the server certificate
label: security

name: driver
description: The Drivers(s) to handle sending notifications. Possible values are messaging, messagingv2, routing, log, test, noop
label: environment

name: transport_url
description: A URL representing the messaging driver to use for notifications. If  not set, we fall back to the same configuration used for RPC.
label: environment

name: topics
description: AMQP topic used for OpenStack notifications.
label: manageability

name: retry
description: The maximum number of attempts to re-send a notification message  which failed to be delivered due to a recoverable error. 0 - No retry,  -1 - indefinite
label: reliability

name: amqp_durable_queues
description: Use durable queues in AMQP.
label: manageability

name: amqp_auto_delete
description: Auto-delete queues in AMQP.
label: manageability

name: ssl
description: Connect over SSL.
label: security

name: ssl_version
description: SSL version to use (valid only if SSL enabled). Valid values are  TLSv1 and SSLv23. SSLv2, SSLv3, TLSv1_1, and TLSv1_2 may be available on some distributions.
label: security

name: ssl_key_file
description: SSL key file (valid only if SSL enabled).
label: security

name: ssl_cert_file
description: SSL cert file (valid only if SSL enabled).
label: security

name: ssl_ca_file
description: SSL certification authority file (valid only if SSL enabled).
label: security

name: kombu_reconnect_delay
description: How long to wait before reconnecting in response to an AMQP consumer cancel notification.
label: reliability

name: kombu_compression
description: EXPERIMENTAL: Possible values are: gzip, bz2. If not set compression  will not be used. This option may not be available in future versions.
label: performance

name: kombu_missing_consumer_retry_timeout
description: How long to wait a missing client before abandoning to send it its  replies. This value should not be longer than rpc_response_timeout.
label: reliability

name: kombu_failover_strategy
description: Determines how the next RabbitMQ node is chosen in case the one we  are currently connected to becomes unavailable. Takes effect only if  more than one RabbitMQ node is provided in config.
label: reliability

name: rabbit_login_method
description: The RabbitMQ login method.
label: manageability

name: rabbit_retry_interval
description: How frequently to retry connecting with RabbitMQ.
label: reliability

name: rabbit_retry_backoff
description: How long to backoff for between retries when connecting to RabbitMQ.
label: reliability

name: rabbit_interval_max
description: Maximum interval of RabbitMQ connection retries. Default is 30 seconds.
label: reliability

name: rabbit_ha_queues
description: Try to use HA queues in RabbitMQ (x-ha-policy: all). If you change  this option, you must wipe the RabbitMQ database. In RabbitMQ 3.0, queue mirroring is no longer controlled by the x-ha-policy argument when  declaring a queue. If you just want to make sure that all queues (except those with auto-generated names) are mirrored across all nodes, run:  'rabbitmqctl set_policy HA '^(?!amq.).*' '{'ha-mode': 'all'}' '
label: manageability

name: rabbit_transient_queues_ttl
description: Positive integer representing duration in seconds for queue TTL  (x-expires). Queues which are unused for the duration of the TTL are  automatically deleted. The parameter affects only reply and fanout  queues.
label: performance

name: rabbit_qos_prefetch_count
description: Specifies the number of messages to prefetch. Setting to zero allows unlimited messages.
label: performance

name: heartbeat_timeout_threshold
description: Number of seconds after which the Rabbit broker is considered down if heartbeat's keep-alive fails (0 disable the heartbeat). EXPERIMENTAL
label: reliability

name: heartbeat_rate
description: How often times during the heartbeat_timeout_threshold we check the heartbeat.
label: reliability

name: enable_proxy_headers_parsing
description: Whether the application is behind a proxy or not. This determines if the middleware should parse the headers or not.
label: manageability

name: enforce_scope
description: This option controls whether or not to enforce scope when evaluating policies. If True, the scope of the token used in the request is compared to the scope_types of the policy being enforced. If the scopes do not match, an InvalidScope exception will be raised. If False, a message will be logged informing operators that policies are being invoked with mismatching scope.
label: manageability

name: policy_file
description: The file that defines policies.
label: manageability

name: policy_default_rule
description: Default rule. Enforced when a requested rule is not found.
label: reliability

name: policy_dirs
description: Directories where policy configuration files are stored. They can be  relative to any directory in the search path defined by the config_dir  option, or absolute paths. The file defined by policy_file must exist  for these directories to be searched.  Missing or empty directories are  ignored.
label: environment

name: remote_content_type
description: Content Type to send and receive data for REST based policy check
label: manageability

name: remote_ssl_verify_server_crt
description: server identity verification for REST based policy check
label: security

name: remote_ssl_ca_crt_file
description: Absolute path to ca cert file for REST based policy check
label: environment

name: remote_ssl_client_crt_file
description: Absolute path to client cert for REST based policy check
label: environment

name: remote_ssl_client_key_file
description: Absolute path client key file REST based policy check
label: environment

name: user
description: User that the privsep daemon should run as.
label: environment

name: group
description: Group that the privsep daemon should run as.
label: manageability

name: capabilities
description: List of Linux capabilities retained by the privsep daemon.
label: manageability

name: thread_pool_size
description: The number of threads available for privsep to concurrently run processes. Defaults to the number of CPU cores in the system.
label: performance

name: helper_command
description: Command to invoke to start the privsep daemon if not using the 'fork' method. If not specified, a default is generated using 'sudo  privsep-helper' and arguments designed to recreate the current  configuration. This command must accept suitable --privsep_context and  --privsep_sock_path arguments.
label: manageability

name: default_quota
description: Default number of resource allowed per tenant. A negative value means unlimited.
label: reliability

name: quota_network
description: Number of networks allowed per tenant. A negative value means unlimited.
label: performance

name: quota_subnet
description: Number of subnets allowed per tenant, A negative value means unlimited.
label: performance

name: quota_port
description: Number of ports allowed per tenant. A negative value means unlimited.
label: reliability

name: quota_driver
description: Default driver to use for quota checks.
label: manageability

name: track_quota_usage
description: Keep in track in the database of current resource quota usage.  Plugins which do not leverage the neutron database should set this flag  to False.
label: debuggability

name: quota_router
description: Number of routers allowed per tenant. A negative value means unlimited.
label: reliability

name: quota_floatingip
description: Number of floating IPs allowed per tenant. A negative value means unlimited.
label: performance

name: quota_security_group
description: Number of security groups allowed per tenant. A negative value means unlimited.
label: reliability

name: quota_security_group_rule
description: Number of security rules allowed per tenant. A negative value means unlimited.
label: reliability

name: ca_file
description: CA certificate file to use to verify connecting clients.
label: security

name: cert_file
description: Certificate file to use when starting the server securely.
label: security

name: key_file
description: Private key file to use when starting the server securely.
label: security

name: version
description: SSL version to use (valid only if SSL enabled). Valid values are  TLSv1 and SSLv23. SSLv2, SSLv3, TLSv1_1, and TLSv1_2 may be available on some distributions.
label: security

name: ciphers
description: Sets the list of available ciphers. value should be a string in the OpenSSL cipher list format.
label: manageability
